title.narrative: WASH IN INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: Institutions (PHUs and schools) have improved capacity to provide sustainable safe water and adequate sanitation facilities by 2018, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.0 Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and healthy environment and improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutions (PHUs and schools) have improved capacity to provide sustainable safe water and adequate sanitation facilities by2018

description.narrative: An additional 94,530 children (48,210 girls and 46,319 boys) in 354 schools (of a target of 358) were provided with hygiene and group handwashing education A total of 15,853 (out of targeted 16,000) adolescent girls were supported with provision of reusable sanitary pads. 63 local female tailors were trained on the fabrication of reusable sanitary towels to improve the sustainability of this intervention. School based institutions were targeted to improve their capacity to provide safe water and adequate sanitation facilities sustainably. (Please see note in statement re: PHUs.) | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
